DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Old Two Digit Disease or Disorder Extent Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Site-specific codes for EOD used by SEER for tumors diagnosed from January 1, 1973, to December 31, 1982, for cancer sites that did not have a 13-digit scheme see EOD--Old 13 Digit [840].

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Old Two Digit Disease or Disorder Extent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Extent of Disease (EOD) used by SEER for tumors diagnosed from January 1, 1973, to December 31, 1982.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredName: Old Two Digit Diseases and Disorders Extent
Property.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.:A finger or toe in human beings or corresponding part in other vertebrates.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

Concepts.definition: Not new, of an earlier time.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
A finger or toe in human beings or corresponding part in other vertebrates.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: Old Two Digit Disease or Disorder Extent Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists_No Value Exists_A finger or toe in human beings or corresponding part in other vertebrates._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences
